translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The Ninth Section
The Discussion of Knowledge Having No Object
“Is knowledge without object?”

analyzed: āmantā  rūpam nibbānam cakkhu āyatanam pe
translated: “Yes.”
“Is visible form, the eye sense-sphere … the mind sense-sphere … the mind object sense-sphere Nibbāna?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is knowledge without object?”
“Yes.”

original: Paññā paññindriyaṁ paññābalaṁ sammādiṭṭhi dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo anārammaṇoti?
analyzed: paññā paññindriyam paññā balam sammādiṭṭhi dhamma vicaya sambojjhaṅgaḥ anārammaṇaḥ ti
translated: “Is understanding, the understanding faculty, the understanding power, right view, the investigation-of-states enlightenment factor without object?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: paññā paññindriyaṁ paññābalaṁ sammādiṭṭhi dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo sārammaṇoti?
analyzed: paññā paññindriyam paññā balam sammādiṭṭhi dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgo sa ārammaṇaḥ ti
translated: “Is understanding, the understanding faculty, the understanding power, right view, the investigation-of-states enlightenment factor with object?”
“Yes.”
“Is knowledge with object?”

“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty … in the mind faculty … in the ear … in the nose … in the tongue … in the body … in the form … in the sound … in the smell … in the taste … in the tangible … in the mind-object … in the mind-consciousness element … in the mind-contact element … in the pleasant feeling … in the painful feeling … in the neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling … in the perception … in the volition … in the consciousness element … in the eye-consciousness element … in the ear … in the nose … in the tongue … in the body … in the mind-consciousness element … in the mind-contact element … in the pleasant feeling … in the painful feeling … in the neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling … in the perception … in the volition … in the consciousness element … in the eye-consciousness element … in the ear … in the nose … in the tongue … in the body … in the mind-consciousness element … in the mind-contact element … in the pleasant feeling … in the painful feeling … in the neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling … in the perception … in the volition … in the consciousness element … in the eye-consciousness element … in the ear … in the nose … in the tongue … in the body … in the mind-consciousness element … in the mind-contact element … in the pleasant feeling … in the painful feeling … in the neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling … in the perception … in the volition … in the consciousness element … in the eye-consciousness element … in the ear … in the nose … in the tongue … in the body … in the mind-consciousness element … in the mind-contact element … in the pleasant feeling … in the painful feeling … in the neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling … in the perception … in the volition … in the consciousness element … in the eye-consciousness element … in the ear … in the nose … in the tongue … in the body … in the mind-consciousness element … in the mind-contact element … in the pleasant feeling … in the painful feeling … in the neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling … in the perception … in the volition … in the consciousness element … in the eye-consciousness element … in the ear … in the nose … in the tongue … in the body … in the mind-consciousness element … in
“Is knowledge without object?”
“Yes.”
“In which of the aggregates is it included?”
“In the formations aggregate.”
“Are formations without object?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the past, the future, and the present?” …
“Are formations without object?”

analyzed: āmantā  vedanā kkhandho saññā kkhandho viññāṇa kkhandho anārammaṇaḥ ti
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Are the feeling aggregate, the perception aggregate, the consciousness aggregate without object?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
Is knowledge included in the aggregate of volitional formations and has no object?
“Yes.”

analyzed: paññā saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā anārammaṇā ati
translated: Is understanding included in the aggregate of volitional formations and has no object?
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the past, the future, and the present?” …

analyzed: paññā saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā sa ārammaṇā ti
translated: Is understanding included in the aggregate of volitional formations and has an object?
“Yes.”

analyzed: ñāṇam saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannam sa ārammaṇanti
translated: Is knowledge included in the aggregate of volitional formations and has an object?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: Ñāṇaṁ saṅkhārakkhandhapariyāpannaṁ anārammaṇaṁ, paññā saṅkhārakkhandhapariyāpannā sārammaṇāti?
analyzed: ñāṇam saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannam anārammaṇa paññā saṅkhāra kkhandha pariyāpannā sa ārammaṇā ti
translated: Is knowledge included in the aggregate of volitional formations and has no object, and is understanding included in the aggregate of volitional formations and has an object?
“Yes.”

analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho ekadesaḥ sārammaṇaḥ ekadesaḥ anārammaṇaḥ ti
translated: Is part of the aggregate of volitional formations an object and part not an object?
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandho ekadesaḥ sārammaṇaḥ ekadesaḥ anārammaṇaḥ ti
translated: Is part of the aggregate of volitional formations an object and part not an object?

original: Āmantā.🔽Vedanākkhandho saññākkhandho viññāṇakkhandho ekadeso sārammaṇo ekadeso anārammaṇoti?
analyzed: āmantā  vedanā kkhandho saññā kkhandho viññāṇa kkhandho ekadesaḥ sārammaṇaḥ ekadesaḥ anārammaṇaḥ ti
translated: “Yes.”
Is part of the aggregate of feeling … part of the aggregate of perception … part of the aggregate of consciousness an object and part not an object?🔽“No.”
You should not say so.
Is knowledge not an object?
“Yes.”

analyzed: arahā cakkhu viññāṇa samaṅgī ñāṇī iti vattabbaḥ ti
translated: Should one who is an arahant and possesses eye-consciousness be called ‘one who possesses knowledge’?
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Atthi tassa ñāṇassa ārammaṇanti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…
analyzed: atthi tassa ñāṇassa ārammaṇanti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: Is there an object of that knowledge?🔽…
Then it is not tenable to say that knowledge is without an object.

analyzed: arahā cakkhu viññāṇa samaṅgī paññavā ati vattabbo ti
translated: Should one who is an arahant and possesses eye-consciousness be called ‘one who possesses understanding’?
The Invitation Ceremony.

original: Atthi tāya paññāya ārammaṇanti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: atthi tāya paññāya ārammaṇanti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: Is there an object of that understanding?🔽…
Then it is not tenable to say that understanding is without an object.
The Discussion of Knowledge Without an Object is finished.
